importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date of the game where the Blue Jays defeated the Mariners, forcing a Game 7 in the ALCS, marking a pivotal moment in the 2025 postseason.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The time period during which the Blue Jays and Mariners are set to play Game 7, with the series concluding in a decisive match in early October 2025.

keyTakeAways: Vladimir Guerrero Jr. hits his sixth home run of the postseason, extending the Blue Jays' lead to 5-0 and sealing the victory over the Mariners.
The Blue Jays defeat the Seattle Mariners 6-2, forcing a Game 7 in the ALCS, marking the first time in Seattle's history to reach such a decisive stage.
The Mariners’ season-high three errors—two in the second inning—played a critical role in giving Toronto an early lead.
Trey Yesavage, a 2024 first-round pick, delivers a strong performance with 31 splitters, seven strikeouts, and minimal runs allowed, showcasing composure under pressure.
The Blue Jays’ first Game 7 since 1985 and the Mariners’ first such game in history underscores the significance of the matchup.
The winner of Game 7 will face the Los Angeles Dodgers in the World Series, with Game 1 scheduled for Friday.

namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The series is pivotal as it determines which team advances to the World Series, with the Blue Jays forcing a decisive Game 7.

summaryOfNewsArticle: In a decisive 6-2 victory over the Seattle Mariners, the Toronto Blue Jays force a Game 7 in the American League Championship Series (ALCS) after Vladimir Guerrero Jr. hits his sixth postseason home run. The game is marked by three critical fielding errors by the Mariners, including two in the second inning, which led to early scoring. Despite a lone run from Josh Naylor in the sixth, the Blue Jays maintain control, with Trey Yesavage delivering a strong pitching performance. The Blue Jays’ first Game 7 since 1985 and the Mariners’ first in franchise history highlight the significance of the matchup. The winner will face the Los Angeles Dodgers in the 2025 World Series, with Game 1 scheduled for Friday.
title: Vladimir Guerrero Jr. hits sixth homer of postseason as Blue Jays dominate Mariners to force ALCS Game 7
